headline: The Fruit of the Wise Man
description: A parable of wisdom and irony — the seeker ascends the mountain to find enlightenment, only to encounter deception that conceals divine truth. Through humor, hunger, and reversal, folly becomes the first taste of understanding.

motifMap.meaning: Fruit as knowledge — wisdom that must be bitten into, not admired.
Mountain as inversion — the sacred climb that reveals folly rather than transcendence.
Trickster energy — divine humor unmasking false reverence.
Grace within irony — truth delivered through absurd means.

associatedMedia.description: Screenshot of Substack post 'The Fruit of the Wise Man' from Wanderer’s Burn, October 2025.
